column4: Hi, I want to have metacity start up on default instead of compiz, how can I do this (8.04)
system, preferences, appearance, visual efects, set to none
do you know of a way to check to see which I am running?
run this, "ps -A | grep -i compiz", see if it finds a compiz process
replace compiz with metacity to search for that instead
do you know how to get compositing (or however it is spelled) on metacity working? or is it enabled by default?

metacity doesn't do compositing... it's one of the reasons for compiz.. there is a small utility if you just want basic transparency without all the other shiny stuff though.. search in synaptic for composite
i've got quite a few posts that says it does, nothing flashy but shadows & window fade etc.
huh.. metacity with window fade and stuff.. news to me at least.. they don't say how they do it?
if you edit the gnome "registry" I think it will stick
just run gconf-editor in a terminal, click your way to apps, metacity, general, compositing manager
eh seems laggy like other people were complaining.
well.. it seems it is brand new.. so it might need some polish before it's running smooth.. it took compiz pretty long to become what it is now
apparently theres a new version that removes a 50fps cap
